posts.post_content: I was totally shocked when I saw this card spoiled. I immediately ordered 4 of them and still can't believe it hasn't budged from $2. It combos well with [Fervor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fervor), but it would have been even better if [Goblin Chieftan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Chieftan) got a reprint. Oh, well...I look forward to abusing this card to the best of my abilities.

Posted By: gatorjunkie (7/5/2012 3:48:37 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I think a Mono-Red goblin EDH deck is now viable, thanks to Krenko.   
  
He's ability is a little high-costed for Standard, but in EDH, it's slightly low. Getting out tokens will be easy with him around, and with all of those Goblin Lords + [Adaptive Automaton](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Adaptive Automaton), they'll definitely be a force to be reckoned with.   
  
it's a shame most goblin spells are expensive, though.
posts.html:
I think a Mono-Red goblin EDH deck is now viable, thanks to Krenko.

He's ability is a little high-costed for Standard, but in EDH, it's slightly low. Getting out tokens will be easy with him around, and with all of those Goblin Lords + Adaptive Automaton, they'll definitely be a force to be reckoned with.

it's a shame most goblin spells are expensive, though.

Posted By: un_diplomatic (7/14/2012 3:31:41 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I like this guy mostly because he's cumulative. You play him, (and because he forms a nice mana curve with [Fervor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fervor)) tap him, you've got a token, even if he's the only one in play. Next turn, tap, you get two more because there are two goblins in play. Turn three, tap him, you've got four more. and so on. and so on. And it works well with [Arms Dealer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arms Dealer), so I'm lucky I pulled a second one from one of the packs when I bought his deck. Pity was, the deck itself pretty much sucked. I mean, why put a guy like this in a deck that's anything but Goblin tribal? Also, in Goblin tribal, use this with cards like [Warbreak Trumpeter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Warbreak Trumpeter) and [Goblin Offensive](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Offensive). Power them up using mana produced by [Battle Hymn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Battle Hymn) or [Brightstone Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brightstone Ritual).   
Also, he's a walking Goblin [Promenade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Promenade). How do you argue with that? Also, he works well with [Kyren Negotiations](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kyren Negotiations), ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
I like this guy mostly because he's cumulative. You play him, (and because he forms a nice mana curve with Fervor) tap him, you've got a token, even if he's the only one in play. Next turn, tap, you get two more because there are two goblins in play. Turn three, tap him, you've got four more. and so on. and so on. And it works well with Arms Dealer, so I'm lucky I pulled a second one from one of the packs when I bought his deck. Pity was, the deck itself pretty much sucked. I mean, why put a guy like this in a deck that's anything but Goblin tribal? Also, in Goblin tribal, use this with cards like Warbreak Trumpeter and Goblin Offensive. Power them up using mana produced by Battle Hymn or Brightstone Ritual.
Also, he's a walking Goblin Promenade. How do you argue with that? Also, he works well with Kyren Negotiations, ... (see all)

posts.post_content: Use [Skirk Prospector](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skirk Prospector) and [Siege-Gang Commander](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Siege-Gang Commander) to get this bad boy out on turn 3.
